player_decision.reason: 9♠4♣ is a very weak offsuit hand in 3-handed play. Avoid risking chips with a marginal steal attempt early in the tournament; preserve stack for better opportunities.
10BB effective heads-up from SB with T3s: limping keeps variance low, realizes equity in position, and avoids facing a shove with a marginal hand against a random opponent.
8h7s is a marginal hand in this heads-up preflop situation. Folding preserves your stack for later, and you’re out of position with a weak range by the big blind.
We have top pair with a weak kicker on a connected board; calling controls the pot and keeps bluffs in while we reassess on the turn.

With middle pair (7s) on a dry flop (Th 6c 7d) and your 8h kickers, a small stab of 10 keeps pot manageable, protects against overcards and backdoor draws, and lets you gauge AliceAI's response on the turn. If she raises, you can re-evaluate.
Top pair with a weak kicker in a limped pot; calling the half-pot stab OOP is standard for pot control and to keep worse hands/bluffs in. Raising overplays; folding is too tight.
Check to the aggressor with a marginal top pair on a draw-heavy board to control pot and allow bluffs; raising risks bloating the pot with a weak kicker.

Turn 5d, we have a middle pair (7s) on a board A: Th 7d 6c with 8h in hand. We have 4 outs to a straight (9s) on the river and a bit of fold equity. A small raise to 20 into a 40-pot pressure can take down the pot if she has a worse hand, and keeps us in with backdoor potential if called.

We have top pair with a weak kicker and a gutshot. Versus a half-pot bet heads-up, calling is standard: we’re ahead of some bluffs and worse Tx, while raising isolates stronger hands and straights. Keep the pot controlled and re-evaluate river.
Check river: our T pair has showdown value; the Ace and diamond flush complete many better hands, so betting is thin and risks a raise. Preserve stack and induce bluffs.

Weak marginal hand (8h7s) on an Ace-high board after heavy action. A small river bet (10) gives some fold equity against overcards or air while risking minimal added chips if called. It's a best-of-bad-options move to pressure a likely ace or busted draws. If faced with a raise, you can reassess.

We hold top pair (T) and face a tiny 10 into 90 river bet. The Ace is a scare card, but we only need ~9% equity; folding is too tight and raising won’t get value or many folds. Call and realize the pot odds.
